item.title: Kathe add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "For instance, on the planet Earth, man had always assumed that he was more intelligent than dolphins because he had achieved so much&mdash;the wheel, New York, wars and so on&mdash;whilst all the dolphins had ever done was muck about in the water having a good time. But conversely, the dolphins had always believed that they were far more intelligent than man&mdash;for precisely the same reasons." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kathe add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
Kathe add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "1492. As children we were taught to memorize this year with pride and joy as the year people began living full and imaginative lives on the continent of North America. Actually, people had been living full and imaginative lives on the continent of North America for hundreds of years before that. 1492 was simply the year sea pirates began to rob, cheat, and kill them." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Kathe add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Let us step into the night and pursue that flighty temptress, adventure." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Kathe add a quote by Sue Monk Kidd
item.description: "Someone who thinks death is the scariest thing doesn't know a thing about life." -- Sue Monk Kidd

item.title: Kathe add a quote by Dean Koontz
item.description: "Humanity is a parade of fools, and I am at the front of it, twirling a baton." -- Dean Koontz

item.title: Kathe add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "The Road goes ever on and on Down from the door where it began. Now far ahead the Road has gone, And I must follow, if I can, Pursuing it with eager feet, Until it joins some larger way Where many paths and errands meet. And whither then? I cannot say" -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Kathe add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "She generally gave herself very good advice, (though she very seldom followed it)." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Kathe add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Kathe add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kathe add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kathe add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain
